title: Catalysing change through cinema
description: Mama Cash is thrilled to announce its fourth-year partnership with the International Documentary Film Festival Amsterdam (IDFA)

details_text.paragraph: Mama Cash is thrilled to announce its fourth-year partnership with the International Documentary Film Festival Amsterdam (IDFA), the world’s largest documentary film festival. The 2023 festival runs from 8 – 19 November; 12 days of events where audiences and film professionals will immerse themselves in a diverse programme of the latest documentary films, interactive projects, exhibitions, performances, post-screening talks and workshops.

Mama Cash is thrilled to announce its fourth-year partnership with the International Documentary Film Festival Amsterdam (IDFA), the world’s largest documentary film festival. The 2023 festival runs from 8 – 19 November; 12 days of events where audiences and film professionals will immerse themselves in a diverse programme of the latest documentary films, interactive projects, exhibitions, performances, post-screening talks and workshops. For the 36th edition of IDFA, Mama Cash is facilitating a screening of the critically acclaimed documentary: “Our Land, Our Freedom” by film makers Meena Nanji & Zippy Kimundu. This film captures issues and topics that Mama Cash is working on, such as land and decolonial justice, human rights and self-led feminist activism. A painful yet hopeful story where two narratives are tied together to show how structural change requires structural fight.

title: Land justice for 2023 IDFA Festival
description: Mama Cash is thrilled to announce its fourth-year partnership with the International Documentary Film Festival Amsterdam (IDFA)

details_text.paragraph: Mama Cash is thrilled to announce its fourth-year partnership with the International Documentary Film Festival Amsterdam (IDFA), the world’s largest documentary film festival. The 2023 festival runs from 8 – 19 November; 12 days of events where audiences and film professionals will immerse themselves in a diverse programme of the latest documentary films, interactive projects, exhibitions, performances, post-screening talks and workshops.

Mama Cash is thrilled to announce its fourth-year partnership with the International Documentary Film Festival Amsterdam (IDFA), the world’s largest documentary film festival. The 2023 festival runs from 8 – 19 November; 12 days of events where audiences and film professionals will immerse themselves in a diverse programme of the latest documentary films, interactive projects, exhibitions, performances, post-screening talks and workshops. For the 36th edition of IDFA, Mama Cash is facilitating a screening of the critically acclaimed documentary: “Our Land, Our Freedom” by film makers Meena Nanji & Zippy Kimundu. This film captures issues and topics that Mama Cash is working on, such as land and decolonial justice, human rights and self-led feminist activism. A painful yet hopeful story where two narratives are tied together to show how structural change requires structural fight.

Mama Cash partnered with IDFA because of the organisation’s long-standing history of supporting feminist artists and critical art. The documentary’s compelling storytelling strongly aligns with our dedication to supporting land defenders, particularly women, girls, and trans and intersex individuals who are safeguarding ancestral lands, waters, and territories. It serves as a poignant homage to the unwavering spirit of resilience, the quest for truth, and the struggle for justice,” says Saranel Benjamin, Mama Cash’s Co- Executive Director.
